meanings.definition: Opposed to reform or changes in a particular system or practice.
meanings.sent1: The antireform group strongly resisted any changes to the school curriculum.
meanings.sent2: Her antireform stance made it difficult to implement any new policies.
meanings.sent3: The antireform committee refused to update their outdated methods, leading to chaos.
meanings.sent4: His antireform attitude was like a stubborn rock in the river of progress.
meanings.sent5: The town's antireform sentiment was palpable, clinging to tradition at all costs.

meanings.definition: A person or group that opposes reform efforts.
meanings.sent1: The antireform was vocal in their opposition to the proposed changes.
meanings.sent2: As an antireform, she constantly fought against any attempts to modernize the system.
meanings.sent3: The antireform's stubbornness was both frustrating and admirable.
meanings.sent4: He was seen as an antireform, standing in the way of progress.
meanings.sent5: The antireform's influence was evident in the resistance to change within the community.
